title: 'British' dad 'beats toddler daughter to death' inside 5-star hotel in Kazakhstan

A British man has reportedly been arrested following the murder of his daughter at a five-star hotel in Kazakhstan.

The child, believed to be one year old, died in hospital after the beating at the InterContinental Hotel in Almaty, according to local media.

The girl's mum ran into the lobby screaming for help, Tangrinews reports .

The site later reported that the dad is a Brit, who is suspected of murdering the child on Thursday morning, October 24.

Most of the blows were to her head, police believe.

No one at the hotel was available for comment about the nationality of those involved.

Mirror Online has contacted the Foreign and Commonwealth Office.

The dad, who is in police custody, could face 15 years behind bars if he is convicted.

Aliya Dauletova, director of the hotel’s sales and marketing department, told Tangrinews: "The hotel staff provided the necessary first aid.

"The ambulance rendered resuscitation to the child, restored pulse and pressure, the child was hospitalized in the first city children's hospital.

"We can’t give all the information, the information is confidential."

Staff were later told the toddler had died in hospital.

A spokesman from the Almaty Police Department confirmed to media in Kazakhstan that an investigation has been launched.

"On October 26, the court sanctioned a measure of restraint in the form of detention for two months," an official said.

"A British citizen is suspected of committing a crime under paragraph 3 of part 2 of article 99 - Murder of a person known to be in a helpless state, as well as involving the abduction of a person or hostage taking."

A pre-trial investigation is reportedly being carried out.

The cause of death has yet to be ascertained.
description: The child, believed to be one year old, died in hospital after being beaten at the InterContinental Hotel in Almaty
